name: 李志鴻
objective: This course covers a wide range of fundamental technologies pertinent to Industry 4.0-Intelligent production, including a brief history of the industrial revolution, artificial intelligence algorithms, technologies and application examples of the Internet of Things, cloud service systems and information security technologies, big data management, analysis, and application examples, intelligent enterprise and factory management systems and applications, automation and robotics technology and applications, etc.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction to Intelligent Production
Week 2 The Past and Present of Artificial Intelligence
Week 3 Principles of Contemporary Artificial Intelligence
Week 4 IoT Fundamental Technologies and Applications:
Week 5 Smart Factory Application Examples
Week 6 Cloud Service System and Information Security Technology
Week 7 Cloud Architecture Security Methods
Week 8 Big Data Capture, Storage, and Management
Week 9 Mid-term examination
Week 10 Application Examples of Big Data
Week 11 E-Manufacturing System Architecture
Week 12 Manufacturing Execution System (MES) functions and applications
Week 13 Analysis of the pros and cons of Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
Week 14 Automation and Robotics and Applications:
Week 15 Intelligent Control System
Week 16 Robot Application Case Study
Week 17 Machine Vision System Architecture and Working Principle
Week 18 Final exam
scorePolicy:
Report grade: 60%
Mid-term exam: 20%
Final exam: 20%
materials:
Teacher's notes
Machine Learning/Tom M. Mitchell/McGraw-Hill
Deep Learning/Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville/MIT Press (http://www.deeplearningbook.org)
